definition: to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: The invading army had massacred many of the garrison after capitulation.
sentences.chinese: 侵略軍在守軍投降後仍將多人屠殺了。

sentences.english: I have stationed another platoon on the island.
sentences.chinese: 我已向那個島派出了又一個排的守軍。

sentences.english: The Americans sent out psychological warfare teams to communicate with the defenders of the depot over microphone.
sentences.chinese: 美國人派出心裏戰小組，用高音喇叭向德國守軍喊話。

sentences.english: It was not even possible for the defenders to find safety den behind the walls.
sentences.chinese: 守軍甚至在城牆之後也找不到安全的避難所。

sentences.english: The defenders put up a strong resistance.
The men in the fort capitulated.
